channel.title: Comments on: Story of the Ghost
channel.description: Scattered pages from an apocryphal diary

item.title: By: Drey
item.dc:creator: Drey
item.description: I have since learned that the woman in the photo, and indeed all of the photos Chassity sent me, is named Yvette Nelson, a model and singer. Her photos can be found at www.yvettenelson.net and at www.thenelsonbrothers.com/mattspix/mattspix.html
item.content:encoded: I have since learned that the woman in the photo, and indeed all of the photos Chassity sent me, is named Yvette Nelson, a model and singer. Her photos can be found at http://www.yvettenelson.net and at http://www.thenelsonbrothers.com/mattspix/mattspix.html

item.title: By: jac1962
item.dc:creator: jac1962
item.description: Too bad Philip K. Dick isn't around anymore - sounds like the seed for a great novel.But then, who needs Philip K. Dick?
item.content:encoded: Too bad Philip K. Dick isn’t around anymore – sounds like the seed for a great novel.But then, who needs Philip K. Dick?

item.title: By: Anonymous
item.dc:creator: Anonymous
item.description: no, but I think I recognize the guy! So when you said you were sick of fake people, you really weren't kidding. Shit. I have to say, though, that I would have asked you out had you not had a girlfriend when we first met. So I don't think you can say that all women would only be interested in you for one thing or other. I kinda think the package is a pretty good one. Don't let the fuckedupedness of this episode keep you from keeping in touch with your "real" friends. Love and hugs, Monica
item.content:encoded: no, but I think I recognize the guy! So when you said you were sick of fake people, you really weren’t kidding. Shit. I have to say, though, that I would have asked you out had you not had a girlfriend when we first met. So I don’t think you can say that all women would only be interested in you for one thing or other. I kinda think the package is a pretty good one. Don’t let the fuckedupedness of this episode keep you from keeping in touch with your “real” friends. Love and hugs, Monica
